description: To apply a consistent style across the website and to make sure each page is adjusted to fit smaller screens (‘mobile-first’).
To show the location of every observation by a user on a map. Option to filter by species.
To reinstate the upload photographs feature.  Perhaps as a premium feature to cover the cost of storing the images.
To develop dedicated mobile apps for iOS and Android devices.  Unlikely until the main website is stable.
To introduce awards for collecting x amount of species/observations, and for collecting sets of birds (e.g. 'birds of prey set', 'garden bird spotter', etc.).
Group related observations with custom 'tags'.  For example, create tags like 'Trip to Scotland 2020', 'in the garden', etc.
A page with a list of the previous x days of the 'Tweet of the Day' feature
Set up a blog to announce news, development progress, and interesting recent observations.
Add option to filter the Life List by year to create a year list.  Year list should be able for each of the years since the user registered.
Option to view the birds index page in a 'tiles' format with a thumbnail image.  As an alternative to the current table setup.
To add further analysis of observations.  Frequency charts for each bird species to demonstrate migration patterns, user observations line graphs, etc...
Design a data-led model to aid with bird identification.
Feature users' photographs in a 'wall' or 'tiles' view.
